attributes.action: End Bonus Tax: Reward Work, Don't Punish It!
attributes.additional_details:
Taxing bonuses discourages employees from striving for excellence. If a significant portion of a bonus is lost to taxes, the incentive to go above and beyond diminishes. This can ultimately harm businesses seeking to retain top talent and maximize productivity. 

Bonuses often represent a substantial portion of a middle-class worker's annual income. Taxing these bonuses places an undue burden on families already grappling with rising costs.
attributes.background: Rising living costs squeeze hardworking families. Taxing employee bonuses, a reward for exceeding expectations, only makes it worse. Exempting bonuses from income tax would provide financial relief and incentivise top performance, ultimately benefiting businesses and the economy.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/659042
